Instructions.Description: This client uses OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials flow to get access tokens automatically
Instructions.UserSecretsNote: For sensitive configuration values like ClientSecret, use User Secrets instead of this file
UserSecretsSetup: 1. Right-click on the project in Visual Studio â†’ Manage User Secrets
2. Or use the command: dotnet user-secrets set 'AzureAd:ClientSecret' 'your-actual-secret'
3. User Secrets will override values in this file for development
Instructions.ImportantNote: Client credentials flow MUST use '.default' scope suffix, not specific scope names like 'Weather.Read'
Steps: 1. Create an Azure AD app registration for this client application
2. Generate a client secret in Azure AD
3. Update the values above with your actual Azure AD details (or use User Secrets for sensitive values)
4. Make sure the API scope uses '.default' suffix for client credentials flow
5. Grant the client application permission to access the API
